runs.comm: bang on the mark as he gets this to swing in on leg stump, with Sharjeel doing well to keep it out
what a beauty of a delivery to get, even if it was a free hit, as he swings this one in low on middle, with Sharjeel just getting a bat on it to deflect it behind to the fine leg boundary
low full toss and again swinging into Sharjeel as he just manages to eke this away to the leg side for a single and get out of the hot seat as Malinga looks good here
length ball slanting away as Shehzad gets forward in defence
slower back of a length delivery which Shehzad does well to get a handle on
shorter one on the pads as Shehzad helps this to the leg side, but doesn't time it sweetly enough to get to the fine leg boundary
rising delivery outside off which is punched straight to short cover
back of a length and wobbling a bit outside off as Shehzad punches to the off side, and is able to get the single thanks to some poor fielding
length ball on middle as Sharjeel calls early to get a single down to mid-on
back of a length and almost chopped onto his stumps as he tries to get Kula off his back of a length line
length ball which Shehzad tries to cut away behind point, but can't escape the fielder
full on middle as Shehzad drives this uppishly to mid-on
going round the wicket to Sharjeel as he eases this off the back foot to the leg side

tosses this one outside off as Shehzad takes the bait with a lofted drive through the cover region, but Thirimanne, stationed at short cover, makes a goalkeeper-like reflex catch to his left, and is able to hold on to the chance after hitting the ground. What a stunner from Thirimanne, and with that Sri Lanka have their first wicket
tossed up on middle as Hafeez drives this before it bounces down to long-on
drifting into the pads, Khan works it to short mid wicket
a little too full from Sachihtra as Hafeez gets on one knee to sweep this powerfully to the midwicket boundary
defends the final ball of the over sensibly to complete a successful over for Sri Lanka
Sharjeel pulls this shorter one confidently to the man at deep midwicket
gets this to nibble in from back of a length as Hafeez comes out of his crease to play this, but the ball angles in to beat the blade
fuller from Kula as Hafeez leans forward to ease this to the leg side for a single
too full as Sharjeel exhibits his class with a classy lofted shot down the ground. This one just oozed of timing as he executed it

in two minds as he plays this length ball shaping away, with the ball catching the outside edge low on the bat, and squeezing through the vacant third man region, with a 'finish' third man doing well to stop it from reaching the boundary
this time goes for the cut shot but is unable to get a connection on the ball
continuing round the wicket to Hafeez, offering little to no space for him to be worked away
similar trajectory as before as Hafeez is finally able to whip it off his pads
flighted on middle as Sharjeel drives this one down to mid-on
Hafeez a little careless in defence as this one hits the top of his bat, spooning up in the air, but out of reach of the spinner
waits on the back foot to cut this away to point, who makes a fine diving effort to stop the ball from travelling too far
not sure whether to go forward or back as he defends this Senanyake offering to the off side to see out the over
fuller delivery outside off as Hafeez looks for the drive through cover
going down the pads as Hafeez is able to tuck this round the corner
full from Mendis as Sharjeel, with minimal footwork, just sends this back over the bowler's head, with long-on unable to prevent it from getting to the boundary despite the outstretched hand
full and on the pads as Sharjeel is unable to penetrate the field on the leg side
Sharjeel shuffles down slightly to heave this over extra-cover, but doesn't time it well enough for it to reach the boundary
hits this one uppishly through cover, but doesn't get it far enough
Hafeez dances down but just can't find the gap on the off side
back of a length on the pads as Hafeez flicks this behind square on the leg side
Sharjeel plays this length ball which bounces higher than expected to the leg side, but thinks against the single
low full toss which is dispatched to the leg side for one

Hafeez looking for the big shot down the ground is held in his tracks by this one which is pitched back of a length, as he adjusts to play this with soft hands to the off side, and set off immediately down to the other end to complete a risky single
Sharjeel just eases this down to mid-on to retain strike for the next over

and some activity straight away as Mathews starts with a slower one which Sharjeel is early on as he gets the edge, but the ball drops short of Sangakkara, who then recovers to fire in a throw at the non-striker's end, but Hafeez able to make his ground
Sharjeel able to guide this one down to third man for a single
length ball angling in as Hafeez leans into a drive through midwicket, but finds the fielder
Hafeez chips this length ball going down the leg side over midwicket for a couple. Not timed at all by the Pakistan captain
punches this back of a length ball down the ground to long-on
opens the face to steer this one down to third man
straight away from improvisation from Sharjeel as he looks for the lofted reverse-sweep, with the ball just beating short third man, who is running behind, and then dies on him
plays this one to deep midwicket for a single
Hafeez waits patiently on the back foot, running hard for the first, as Perera, under pressure, makes a hash of it at midwicket, allowing for the extra run
defended on the front foot back to the bowler
shimmies down the track to power this back of a length ball to long-on, but doesn't get much timing on it
in the slot as Sharjeel is happy to milk the single down to long-off
glides this length ball outside off to third man, who does well to dive to his left to stop the ball from hitting the rope
back of a length and Sharjeel has a flash, with the keeper taking the ball thereafter
another slower one outside off as Sharjeel just runs this one down to third man
shuffles down the track before paddle-sweeping Mathews high over fine leg for a boundary
Mathews doing the job of a bowling machine here as he offers another lolly pop outside off which Hafeez just slams back over the bowler's head for a huge six. First six of the Pakistani innings!
slower one going leg side as Hafeez gets a bottom-edge on it down to fine leg
starts off with a length ball outside off as Sharjeel just eases this to mid-off
slower ball heading down the pads as Hafeez gently clips this behind for one

Sharjeel looking to stand and deliver again as he clubs this one straight into the air. This goes quite high up as Dilshan steadies himself at long-on, and after failing on the first take, is able to roll and clutch on to the rebound before it hits the ground with his right arm. Excellent recovery after it looked like he may spill it
slower ball on middle which is played away to the leg side for a single
back of a length and rising slightly as he Akmal plays inside of the line, with the ball carrying through to the keeper
an inviting length from Mathews is smacked right back from where it came as Akmal just bludgeons through the line all the way to the straight boundary
Hafeez flicks this away nicely behind square for a single
cut shot which is played late by Umar, as deep point fields the ball

Mendis fires a quicker one on middle as Hafeez gets down on one knee to sweep this through the leg side. Mendis like this straight away as soon as the ball thuds into the front pad, with the umpire taking a bit of time before confirming the decision

and Maqsood straight away hits this back at the bowler, with Mendis getting a finger on it before it richochets onto the non-striker's stumps. Umar Akmal looks guilty out there as the umpire calls for the third umpire. Looks like the fingers did get a touch on the ball, and Umar did seem to be backing up too much as he fails to get his bat down before the ball knocks over the bails. And it is given out! That is the fourth wicket down for Pakistan, and from being 69 for 1, they have now crashed to 76 for 4
and Maqsood hits a classy drive on the up through extra-cover, with the ball having enough on it to reach the boundary
drifting on off as Maqsood drives this through the off side
back of a length as Amin punches this off the back foot to get off the mark
gets this to rear off a length outside off as Maqsood is drawn into the shot, but the ball leaves him at the last moment
shuffles over to the off side to work this fuller delivery to the leg side for one
back of a length slanting away as Maqsood fails to punch this through the off side
straying on the pads and Amin punishes him with a gentle clip to the fine leg boundary
full and just outside off as Amin leans into a drive through extra-cover
Amin plays this one late as the ball goes across him to the keeper
shorter length on the pads as Amin is able to tuck this away to the leg side
Maqsood eases this one to the leg side for a single
length ball outside off as Amin looks to run this past short third man, but is unable to do so
fuller outside off which is driven down to long-off
this one is heading down the leg side as Maqsood just powers this over the midwicket boundary for a huge six to finish the over

Rameez Raja waxing lyrical about Amin and what does the southpaw do? He only goes ahead and lofts this straight into the hands of Chandimal, at silly mid-off, who takes a good low catch. Pakistan are slowly slipping here, even though the equation is still very much in their favour
tests him straightaway with a bouncer outside off which Afridi decides to leave alone. Pakistan fans everywhere can breathe just a little easier
once again fires in a bouncer, this time on middle, as Afridi ducks under it
Afridi lucky to get this away as Malinga fires in another bouncer which Afridi goes after, with the ball landing ahead of a sprinting deep square leg, but doesn't quite reach the rope

Malinga seems to have a set plan here as he delivers a fourth consecutive boundary, this time outside off. Sangakkara expected this to go straight into his gloves but Afridi just hangs his bat at the last moment to steer this almost all the way to the third man rope for four
ends the over with a beautiful yorker on middle which Afridi is able to ease down to long-on without too much fuss
low full toss outside off which is driven to cover
length ball outside off which is directed to midwicket instead by Maqsood
Afridi does what Afridi does best. This full toss is swatted over midwicket so powerfully that it travels so high it goes into the upper tier
gets this one full and on off as Afridi does well to keep it out
full and wide and Afridi just doesn't have the room to get this away on the off side
Afridi is on point so far as he lofts this over extra-cover for a straight six, leaving the equation at 29 runs off 24 balls. Surely Pakistan can see this out, can't they?
Malinga adds another twist to the tail as he delivers a slower yorker bang on middle which Maqsood is late on, with the umpire raising the finger. They check for the no-ball, but he was fine

this one looked plumb as it rapped Bhatti's front pads, with the Sri Lankans appealing while the Pakistan batsmen ran the single. Replays show that this was plumb as it was a low, full toss swinging in
Afridi is not perturbed by Malinga as he heaves a full delivery down to long-on
in the slot and Bhatti lofts this gently over mid-on
full and on leg as Afridi is able to squirt this away to deep extra-cover

low full toss again as Malinga goes for the yorker, but this one had some bat on it before it hit the pads. The umpire almost seemed to be moving his right arm, but was probably getting his hand into a more comfortable position in his pocket
full from Perera as Afridi gets this away to long-on
fires in a bouncer as Bhatti is not at all in control of this as he top edges this behind to third man, beating third man to the boundary, despite his dive

full, swinging delivery as Bhatti goes for the big heave. Perera appeals for leg before, as the ball seemed to hit the pad, and in all that commotion Bhatti runs down the track, sees his partner is not interested, and just makes it back to his crease to beat Dilshan's throw. The third umpire is called, but the decision is ruled not out

gets this one horribly wrong as Perera fires a full toss, which was heading leg side, and Afridi does the smart thing by paddling this on its way to the rope. Perera not at all amused as Pakistan bring it close once again
full and on the pads as Afridi flicks this behind square to fine leg, running hard in order to complete two
yorker from Perera which is driven down to long-off, keeping Afridi on strike for the next over
fires this full on the pads in search of a yorker as Afridi has this covered to get this away to the leg side
cheeky shot from Bhatti as he angles his bat outside off to get this wide of third man, giving him enough to run back for the second
full and on middle as Bhatti just eases this to the leg side for one
tests him with a shorter one as Afridi takes the bait, hitting this one high in the air, but luckily it falls just before the fielder coming in deep from the boundary

Bhatti clears the front leg, looking to belt this out of Dubai Sports City, but instead succeeds in hitting this one straight up in the air. Thisara calls for the catch, even though Sanga is close with the gloves, and manages to hold on to the skier, with a nice roll to finish it off

Afridi on strike and hits this to the off side, hesitant as he runs down, before deciding to go ahead with it. Tanvir was a little slow out of the blocks as the fielder picks up the ball and fires it at the striker's end, with Sanga taking the ball and hitting the stumps. Replays show that Tanvir was just in. Pakistan will be pleased that Afridi will be on strike for the final over

Afridi does it! He does it!  Afridi paddle sweeps this ball pitching outside off beautifully over fine leg, timing it so sweetly that it just clears the rope to bring an end to the contest. What a knock from this experienced campaigner! He managed to hold his nerve to see his country through for a win
